title: Wait... So?
body:
You took a champion {{champion:27}}  who was basically impossible to catch even without Rylais, and just as hard to escape from, unless you're fizz or Kassadin.. and made him.... faster?

Someone will need to explain this to me.
Im not sure I understand.

You say it's to stop him being countered by slippery champions.
So, now that he can _also_ catch slippery champions, how is his increased speed going to affect the other 130 champions who already couldn't get away from him? _(Not even a rhetorical question!)_

Not to mention that if he isnt countered by slippery champs anymore... what the hell is he supposed to be countered by?

replies.body:
Good advice, except he's so fast with his ult/ghost/items/rylais/W slow, _(and now his new passive.)_ that no matter which direction you run, he positions himself in front of you. 

It used to be a choice, if you chased singed, you died. 
Now its his choice.

Depends on who you are.

There 81 champs who can't just 'hop a wall', even with their ult.
So chances are, you probably won't be someone with that function. 
What do you do now?

I'm not suggesting every single champ should be able to escape from Singed every time.

But if you're going up against a Singed it's a pretty surefire way to get away from him.
